title: Scaffold Vite + React + TypeScript Project
description: Execute `npm create vite@latest` with the `react-ts` template. Initialize a git repository. This covers WI-001.
sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
acceptance_criteria: Project created, npm install completes, dev server starts.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Manual verification
business_value: Enables all future frontend development.

title: Integrate Core Libraries (MUI, Redux, i18n)
description: Install and configure Material-UI, Redux Toolkit, and react-i18next. Covers WI-002, WI-003, WI-004.
sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
acceptance_criteria: Basic MUI button renders with custom theme, Redux store is accessible, UI string loaded from translation file.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests and manual verification
business_value: Provides foundational libraries for UI, state, and internationalization.

title: Design Responsive Grid System and Breakpoints
description: Analyze REQ-1-005 and define the specific breakpoints for mobile, tablet, and desktop. Design the main layout structure using Material-UI's Grid system and CSS media queries.
sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
acceptance_criteria: Breakpoints are documented, PoC layout reflows correctly, design accounts for mobile navigation.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Code review of the design and PoC component
business_value: Defines the core structure for a consistent user experience across all devices.

title: Implement MainLayout Component with Responsive AppBar and Drawer
description: Build the `MainLayout.tsx` component that includes a responsive AppBar that collapses into a hamburger menu on mobile, and a Drawer for navigation. Fulfills REQ-1-005.
sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
acceptance_criteria: AppBar and Drawer are responsive, layout adapts smoothly on resize.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Component tests and manual verification on different viewports
business_value: Provides the main application shell and navigation structure.

title: Integrate and Wrap Math Expression Parser
description: Research, select, and install `math.js`. Create `calculationService.ts` to wrap the library, exposing a simple `evaluate` function. This covers WI-009.
sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
acceptance_criteria: Evaluate service correctly computes '2+3*4', throws typed error for syntax errors, and is fully unit tested.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests pass in CI pipeline
business_value: Core logic for all calculations in the application.

title: Implement Calculator State Slice in Redux
description: Create a Redux slice (`calculatorSlice.ts`) to manage the calculator's state, including `currentExpression`, `result`, `history`, and `angleMode`.
sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
acceptance_criteria: Reducers for appendInput, calculate, and clear are working correctly. Thunks handle success and error states.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests for the Redux slice pass
business_value: Centralized state management for the entire calculator feature.

title: Implement Display and Keypad Components
description: Build the `Display.tsx` and `Keypad.tsx` components. Connect them to the Redux store to display the current expression/result and dispatch actions on button clicks.
sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
acceptance_criteria: Keypad buttons dispatch correct actions, Display shows correct state from store, '=' button works, all buttons accessible.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Component tests and E2E tests for a basic calculation
business_value: Core user interface for all calculator interactions.

title: Write E2E Test for Basic Arithmetic and Order of Operations
description: Using Cypress, create a test that simulates a user typing '5+3*2' and asserts that the final result displayed is '11'. Also test division by zero and ensure the error message is shown.
sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
acceptance_criteria: Test simulates input, asserts correct result for order of operations, asserts correct error for division by zero, runs in CI.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Test passes in the CI pipeline
business_value: Ensures the core calculation logic is working correctly end-to-end.

title: Write E2E and Accessibility Tests for Responsive Layout
description: Using Cypress, write E2E tests that verify the layout on different viewports (`cy.viewport`). Integrate Axe to run automated accessibility checks for WCAG 2.1 AA compliance (REQ-1-034).
sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
acceptance_criteria: Cypress tests pass for mobile and desktop, hamburger menu visibility is confirmed, Axe scan reports no critical violations.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: CI pipeline successfully runs the Cypress tests
business_value: Validates the application's usability and accessibility on all target devices.

title: Implement Angle Mode Logic in Calculation Service
description: Extend `calculationService.ts` to accept an `angleMode` parameter. Override the built-in `sin`, `cos`, `tan` functions to perform necessary conversions (e.g., degrees to radians) before calling the underlying `Math` functions.
sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
acceptance_criteria: Service correctly calculates sin(90) in DEG, sin(pi/2) in RAD, and sin(100) in GRAD modes.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests pass
business_value: Enables accurate scientific calculations, a core product requirement.

title: Implement Angle Mode Switcher and Display Indicator
description: Add a button or toggle group to the UI for switching angle modes. This control should dispatch an action to update the `angleMode` in the Redux store. Update the `Display` component to show the current mode (DEG/RAD/GRAD).
sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
acceptance_criteria: User can cycle through modes, display indicator updates instantly, control is keyboard accessible.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Component tests and manual verification
business_value: Provides essential user control for trigonometric functions.

title: Write E2E Test for Angle Mode Switching and Calculation
description: Create a Cypress test that clicks the mode switcher to select 'DEG', calculates 'sin(90)', and asserts the result is 1. The test should then switch to 'RAD', calculate 'cos(pi)', and assert the result is -1.
sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
acceptance_criteria: Test successfully simulates mode switching, asserts correct results in different modes, and runs in CI.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Test passes in CI pipeline
business_value: Ensures trigonometric functions are reliable and accurate end-to-end.

title: Implement History Panel Component
description: Build the `HistoryPanel.tsx` component. It will subscribe to the `history` array in the Redux store and render a list of past calculations. Each item should be clickable.
sprint_goal: Establish CI/CD, project structures, and deliver a functional, responsive scientific calculator for anonymous users.
acceptance_criteria: Component displays history in reverse chronological order, shows empty state, and clicking an item dispatches an update action.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Component tests and manual verification
business_value: Provides a core usability feature for reviewing and reusing calculations.

title: Define AWS Cognito Infrastructure in Terraform
description: Write Terraform HCL to provision the Cognito User Pool and App Client. Configure the password policy as per REQ-1-071 and set up OAuth 2.0 with PKCE.
sprint_goal: Implement the complete user authentication lifecycle. Establish the backend services and database schemas for all user-specific data.
acceptance_criteria: Terraform apply succeeds, Cognito resources are created with correct password policy and PKCE flow configuration.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Review of applied resources in AWS Console
business_value: Provisions the core identity and authentication service for the application.

title: Implement NestJS JWT Strategy and Guard for Cognito
description: Configure `passport-jwt` in the NestJS backend. Create a `JwtStrategy` that retrieves the JWKS from the Cognito endpoint to validate incoming JWTs. Create a `JwtAuthGuard` to protect routes.
sprint_goal: Implement the complete user authentication lifecycle. Establish the backend services and database schemas for all user-specific data.
acceptance_criteria: Strategy fetches/caches JWKS, guard validates Cognito token, guard rejects invalid tokens with 401.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests for the guard
business_value: Core backend security mechanism to protect user data and APIs.

title: Create Migration for `calculation_history` Table
description: Write a TypeORM migration script to create the `calculation_history` table with columns for `id`, `user_id` (FK to users), `expression`, `result`, and `created_at`.
sprint_goal: Implement the complete user authentication lifecycle. Establish the backend services and database schemas for all user-specific data.
acceptance_criteria: Migration `up` and `down` scripts run successfully, schema matches specification.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Successful execution of the migration script
deployment_notes: Migration must run before application deployment.
business_value: Creates the database structure to persist user calculation history.

title: Implement Backend Service and Controller for History
description: Create the `HistoryModule` in NestJS. Implement the controller with `GET /history` and `POST /history` endpoints. Implement the service to handle database interactions, ensuring all queries are scoped by the authenticated user's ID.
sprint_goal: Implement the complete user authentication lifecycle. Establish the backend services and database schemas for all user-specific data.
acceptance_criteria: POST endpoint saves item for user, GET endpoint returns only items for user, both endpoints protected by JwtAuthGuard.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests pass
business_value: Provides the API for managing persistent user calculation history.

title: Create Migration for `users` and `custom_modes` Tables
description: Write a TypeORM migration script to create the `users` and `custom_modes` tables with schemas from REQ-1-058 and REQ-1-059, including the JSONB column for `definition`.
sprint_goal: Implement the complete user authentication lifecycle. Establish the backend services and database schemas for all user-specific data.
acceptance_criteria: Migration runs successfully, tables are created with correct columns, types, and foreign key constraints.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Schema verification in the database
business_value: Creates the foundational database structures for all user-specific data.

title: Implement Backend CRUD Service and Controller for Custom Modes
description: Create the `ModesModule` in NestJS. Implement the controller, service, and entity for all CRUD operations on custom modes. Ensure all endpoints are protected by the `JwtAuthGuard` and queries are scoped by user ID.
sprint_goal: Implement the complete user authentication lifecycle. Establish the backend services and database schemas for all user-specific data.
acceptance_criteria: API endpoints for CRUD are created, user can only access/modify their own modes, definition payload is validated.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests for all endpoints and authorization scenarios
business_value: Provides the backend API for managing the application's flagship feature.

title: Define Formula Executor Lambda in Terraform
description: Write Terraform HCL to provision the AWS Lambda function, including its execution role with minimal permissions (CloudWatch Logs only), memory/timeout settings, and environment variables.
sprint_goal: Implement the complete user authentication lifecycle. Establish the backend services and database schemas for all user-specific data.
acceptance_criteria: Terraform apply succeeds, Lambda function and IAM role are created, resource limits are set.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Resources are visible and correctly configured in the AWS Console
business_value: Provisions the secure, isolated environment for executing user-defined code.

title: Set up and Configure OpenAPI (Swagger) Generation
description: Integrate `@nestjs/swagger` into the backend. Add decorators to all existing and new DTOs and controllers to generate a complete OpenAPI 3.0 specification. Expose the UI at `/api-docs`.
sprint_goal: Implement the complete user authentication lifecycle. Establish the backend services and database schemas for all user-specific data.
acceptance_criteria: /api-docs endpoint is available with Swagger UI, all endpoints are documented, data models are correct.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Manual inspection of the generated Swagger UI
business_value: Provides clear, auto-generated API documentation for developers and consumers.

title: Implement User Registration Form and Client-Side Validation
description: Create the `Register.tsx` component with fields for email, password, and password confirmation. Implement client-side validation for required fields, email format, and password match.
sprint_goal: Connect the frontend to persistence backends. Implement the full login/registration flow and build the custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: Form renders correctly, validation errors appear, submit button is disabled until form is valid.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Component tests for form validation
business_value: Provides the user interface for new user onboarding.

title: Integrate Registration Form with AWS Cognito SDK
description: Add logic to the `Register.tsx` component to call the AWS Cognito sign-up function on form submission. Handle success (auto-login, redirect) and error states.
sprint_goal: Connect the frontend to persistence backends. Implement the full login/registration flow and build the custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: Successful submission creates user in Cognito, handles duplicate email error, handles weak password error.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E tests for registration success and failure
business_value: Connects the registration UI to the backend identity service.

title: Implement Frontend Auth Service for PKCE Flow
description: Create a client-side `AuthService.ts` to manage the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code flow with PKCE. It should handle generating the code verifier/challenge, redirecting to Cognito, and exchanging the authorization code for tokens.
sprint_goal: Connect the frontend to persistence backends. Implement the full login/registration flow and build the custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: Service generates valid code_challenge, constructs authorize URL, and can exchange auth code for tokens.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests and integration with the Login UI
deployment_notes: RISK-002: Incorrect implementation of security flow
business_value: Implements the secure authentication protocol for the client application.

title: Implement Login Form UI and State Management
description: Create the `Login.tsx` component and integrate it with the `AuthService`. Handle UI states for loading, error, and success. Upon receiving tokens, dispatch actions to update the global Redux auth state.
sprint_goal: Connect the frontend to persistence backends. Implement the full login/registration flow and build the custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: User can initiate login, app handles Cognito redirect, user is redirected on success and UI reflects logged-in state.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E tests for the complete login journey
business_value: Provides the user interface for authentication.

title: Integrate Frontend History with Backend API
description: Use RTK Query to create API hooks for fetching and creating history items. Upon login, trigger the fetch query. After a calculation, call the creation mutation.
sprint_goal: Connect the frontend to persistence backends. Implement the full login/registration flow and build the custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: On login, GET /history is called and populates panel. On calculate, POST /history is called. UI handles loading/error states.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E test for login, history load, and new calculation persistence
business_value: Enables persistent, cross-device calculation history for registered users.

title: Develop Custom Mode Wizard Shell and Step 1 (Info)
description: Create the main `ModeCreatorWizard.tsx` component to manage the multi-step flow. Implement the first step for entering the mode's name and description, with client-side validation.
sprint_goal: Connect the frontend to persistence backends. Implement the full login/registration flow and build the custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: Wizard component renders, can navigate between steps, Step 1 form validates name field.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Component tests
business_value: Provides the foundational UI for creating custom modes.

title: Implement Wizard Step 2 (Define Variables)
description: Create the component for the 'Define Variables' step. Allow users to dynamically add/edit/remove input and output variables, with validation for unique and valid names.
sprint_goal: Connect the frontend to persistence backends. Implement the full login/registration flow and build the custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: User can add/remove variables, validation prevents duplicates/invalid names, 'Next' button disabled until valid state.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Component tests for list management and validation
business_value: Enables users to define the interface for their custom calculators.

title: Integrate Wizard with Backend Create Endpoint
description: Implement the final 'Save' logic in the wizard. On submission, gather the state from all steps, format it into the required JSON `definition`, and call the `POST /modes` API endpoint. Handle success and error responses.
sprint_goal: Connect the frontend to persistence backends. Implement the full login/registration flow and build the custom mode creation wizard.
acceptance_criteria: Successful save navigates to management screen, success notification shown, API errors handled within the wizard.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E test for creating a complete custom mode
business_value: Connects the custom mode creator to the persistence layer, allowing users to save their work.

title: Implement Secure Lambda Sandbox with `isolated-vm`
description: Develop the Node.js AWS Lambda function. Implement the core logic using `isolated-vm` to create a secure V8 isolate, inject an allow-list of math functions, execute the user's formula script with strict resource limits, and return the result.
sprint_goal: Launch the flagship user-extensible feature by building the custom mode creation wizard and the secure execution engine, allowing users to create and run their own tools.
acceptance_criteria: Lambda calculates valid formula, throws error on access to globals, times out on infinite loops, `vm2` is not a dependency.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Extensive unit tests, including negative security tests.
deployment_notes: RISK-001 & RISK-005: Sandboxing untrusted code is extremely high-risk.
business_value: Provides the secure execution environment required for the application's most innovative feature.

title: Implement Backend Endpoint to Invoke Execution Lambda
description: Create the `POST /modes/:id/execute` endpoint in NestJS. This endpoint will fetch the mode definition, validate the incoming input variables against it, invoke the AWS Lambda execution service with the formulas and inputs, and return the result.
sprint_goal: Launch the flagship user-extensible feature by building the custom mode creation wizard and the secure execution engine, allowing users to create and run their own tools.
acceptance_criteria: Endpoint is protected, calls Lambda with correct payload, handles success and error responses from Lambda.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests that mock the Lambda SDK call.
business_value: Orchestrates the entire custom mode execution flow from user request to secure calculation.

title: Implement Custom Mode Management Screen
description: Create the UI to list a user's custom modes, with controls for Launch, Edit, Delete, Import, and Export. This covers WI-028, WI-032, WI-033.
sprint_goal: Launch the flagship user-extensible feature by building the custom mode creation wizard and the secure execution engine, allowing users to create and run their own tools.
acceptance_criteria: Screen fetches and displays user's modes, Delete button works, Launch button navigates to runner UI.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E tests
business_value: Provides the central hub for users to interact with and manage their custom creations.

title: Implement Custom Mode Runner UI
description: Develop the `ModeRunner.tsx` component. This component will fetch a mode's definition, dynamically render a form for its inputs, and on submission, call the execution endpoint. It will then display the results or errors.
sprint_goal: Launch the flagship user-extensible feature by building the custom mode creation wizard and the secure execution engine, allowing users to create and run their own tools.
acceptance_criteria: Component renders inputs from mode definition, 'Calculate' calls execution API, outputs are populated from response, errors are displayed.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E test for launching and using a custom mode.
business_value: Provides the user interface for executing and getting value from custom modes.

title: Load Test Custom Formula Execution Endpoint
description: Create and run a load test script (e.g., using k6) that targets the `POST /modes/:id/execute` endpoint. Measure the P95 latency to ensure it is below the 500ms NFR (REQ-1-043).
sprint_goal: Launch the flagship user-extensible feature by building the custom mode creation wizard and the secure execution engine, allowing users to create and run their own tools.
acceptance_criteria: Load test script is created, a test run is executed, P95 latency is documented and confirmed to be < 500ms.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Review of the test report.
deployment_notes: RISK-008: Lambda cold starts might affect results.
business_value: Ensures the custom mode feature meets performance requirements under load.

title: Write E2E Test for Login and Data Loading
description: Create a Cypress test that programmatically logs in a test user, verifies that a JWT is acquired, and confirms that subsequent API calls to fetch user data (e.g., `/history`) are successful.
sprint_goal: Launch the flagship user-extensible feature by building the custom mode creation wizard and the secure execution engine, allowing users to create and run their own tools.
acceptance_criteria: Test successfully logs in user, asserts UI updates to logged-in state, verifies authenticated API call succeeds.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Test passes in the CI pipeline.
business_value: Provides end-to-end validation of the entire authentication and data loading flow.

title: Implement IndexedDB Service for Queuing Failed Requests
description: Create a TypeScript service (`offlineQueueService.ts`) that provides a simple API to add, retrieve, and delete request objects from an IndexedDB object store. Use a library like `idb` for simplicity.
sprint_goal: Enhance application resilience and support by implementing robust offline data synchronization.
acceptance_criteria: Service can persist, retrieve, and delete a request object from IndexedDB.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Unit tests pass.
business_value: Provides the foundational client-side storage for the offline synchronization feature.

title: Implement 'Last-Write-Wins' Logic on Backend
description: Modify backend services for mutable data to handle conflict resolution. The incoming request should contain a client timestamp, which is compared against the `updated_at` field in the database. If the client's timestamp is older, reject with a 409 Conflict.
sprint_goal: Enhance application resilience and support by implementing robust offline data synchronization.
acceptance_criteria: Update with newer timestamp succeeds, update with older timestamp is rejected with 409, logic is transactional.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Integration tests simulating conflicting updates.
deployment_notes: RISK-002: Data corruption due to faulty logic
business_value: Ensures data consistency when users make changes from multiple devices or in offline mode.

title: Implement API Interceptor and Sync Manager Logic
description: Create an Axios interceptor that catches network errors and queues the request. Create a `SyncManager` that listens for `online` events, processes the queue, handles success, and manages conflicts (409 responses).
sprint_goal: Enhance application resilience and support by implementing robust offline data synchronization.
acceptance_criteria: Failed API call is queued, re-sent on reconnection, item removed on 2xx, local state refreshed on 409.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: E2E tests using Cypress network interception.
deployment_notes: RISK-002: This involves managing complex, asynchronous state transitions and error conditions.
business_value: Core logic that makes the offline feature functional and reliable.

title: Write E2E Tests for Offline Sync Scenarios
description: Using Cypress network interception, create tests for: 1) Creating data offline and verifying it syncs on reconnection. 2) The conflict resolution scenario where a local change is overridden by a server change.
sprint_goal: Enhance application resilience and support by implementing robust offline data synchronization.
acceptance_criteria: Offline creation test passes, conflict resolution test passes asserting UI updates to server's state.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
testing_requirements: Tests pass in the CI pipeline.
business_value: Provides critical quality assurance for the complex and high-risk offline synchronization feature.
